results.title: Echoes that remain
results.creator_credit: Arnold Schwartzman, Marvin Hier and Simon Wiesenthal Centre
results.brief_description: Martin Landau and Miriam Margolyes narrate “Echoes that remain” a moving documentary about the people of the shtetl and their lives before the Holocaust. Director Arnold Schwartzman combines past and present as archival footage is intercut with live action sequences filmed at the sites of former Jewish communities in Czechoslovakia, Hungary, Poland and Romania. The production crew’s research and admiration for the subject matter is evident and echoes of the film will remain with the viewer. Presented by one of America’s leading Jewish cultural institutions, the Simon Wiesenthal Centre. Music performed by the Royal Philharmonic Orchestra.

results.title: Where eagles nest. Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: Frank Muscolino and Australian Wildlife Video & Documentaries
results.brief_description: Cameraman and director Frank Muscolino spent seven years in the Great Dividing Range and foothills recording the life cycle of a pair of eagles. There are four eagles in total that he follows, one pair lives in thick forest of the Great Dividing Range near Mount Disappointment. The second pair live in quite a different situation, nesting near farm land and having plenty of access to food. The director is able to win the trust of these majestic birds of prey, thus allowing him to capture close ups of mating, nest building and chicks growing up and being nurtured.

results.title: The Sea eagle (Revised edition)
results.creator_credit: Frank Muscolino and Australian Wildlife Video & Documentaries
results.brief_description: The focus of this documentary is the endangered sea eagle. Haliaeetus Leucogaster, or the white bellied sea eagle has suffered a massive decrease in population due to man’s presence and encroachment into the eagles’ natural habitat. As a result of this intrusion, the birds have had to move from their natural habitat of the seashore to inland lakes and rivers. Director Frank Muscolino follows two pairs of sea eagles who have made this inland migration and are nesting in the Yan Yean reservoir. It was a project that took him five years. Frank also films sea eagles at Eildon and Metung, both in Victoria.

results.title: Liberation: May 8 9AM 1945
results.creator_credit: Arnold Schwartzman, Marvin Hier, Simon Wiesenthal Centre and Moriah Films
results.brief_description: This video explores the Allied campaign to liberate Europe and Hitler’s genocidal war against the Jews. It combines film footage, music, radio broadcasts and interviews. It uses 1942, (a time when Hitler was still at the heights of his power) as a starting point, and ends at V-E Day. Narrated by Ben Kinglsey, Miriam Margolyes, Patrick Stewart, Jean Boht and Whoopi Goldberg.

results.title: Timpson's country churches
results.brief_description: Join John Timpson as he traipses across the country in search of churches and the oddities, curiosities and tales they harbour. John visits over twenty churches, reflecting on them with amusement and affection and an interest in the people who maintain country churches, thus perpetuating the position of churches in village life.

results.title: Peter Beales: a celebration of old roses
results.creator_credit: Vivian Russell, Michelle Fox and Vivian Russell Incorporated
results.brief_description: For anyone interested in Old Roses, Peter Beales should be a familiar name as his nursery contains one of the world’s largest collections of Old Roses. In this documentary Peter takes the viewer on a potted history of Old Roses, from Species through to the Teas. He looks at their place in history and their evolution. The process of hybridizing is explained by Peter’s daughter, Amanda Gipp, and we watch the Beales family at the Sandringham and Royal Norfolk Shows. An eleven minute pictorial index of the roses discussed throughout the video is presented following the credits.

results.title: Great gardens of the American west
results.brief_description: There are some wonderful public and private gardens dotting North America’s West Coast and gardening enthusiast Grahame Beakhurst visits some of them, including; a Japanese Tea Garden, Golden Gate Park, San Fransisco Bellevue Botanical Garden, Washington Thompson’s California Heather Garden, Bank of America Roof Garden, San Fransisco Filoli Gardens, Woodside, California, Peter Symcox’s Garden, British Columbia American Ranch Style Garden renovation, Washington Harland Hand’s Garden and El Cerrito, California. Based on the “Discovery” series “Guerilla Gardener”.

results.title: Barbed wire and mandolins
results.creator_credit: Nicola Zaraglia, Sam Grana and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: When Italy became an active player in the Second World War in 1940, the Canadian government began to fear the Italian community within Canada as a threat to national security. The action they took was to use the Canadian Mounted Police Force to contain alleged facist sympathizers. Seven hundred of the accused sympathizers were held in internment camps for up to three years. The majority of detainees were held at Petawawa, Ontario. Through interviewing Italian-Canadians who were affected by these actions, one discovers that there was a spirit of camaraderie and hope amongst those at Petawawa as the internees coped with their situation in the any way they could, such as through music, art and gardening. Despite these diversions, what they have lost financially and socially in the community remains with them forever.

results.title: Gina Jeffreys: somebody's daughter the story so far
results.brief_description: This video offers an insight into the background, aspirations, influences, thoughts and dreams of country singer Gina Jeffreys. Born and raised in Toowoomba, Gina moved away from her family to settle in Sydney and further her musical career which began when she won the Star Maker award in 1991 (although she does have fond memories of busking at the local Mexican restaurant). Since then Gina has been awarded the Golden Guitar at Tamworth for Best Female Vocalist three years in a row. Gina relates memories of her rise to fame and footage is provided from the launch of her latest album, “Somebody’s daughter”. Full music clips are provided of “Dancin’ with Elvis”, “Josephine” and “I haven’t got a heart”.

results.title: Endless harmony: the Beach Boys story
results.creator_credit: Alan Boyd, Stephanie Bennett and Brother Records
results.brief_description: This documentary traces the history of America’s most popular 60s band from their humble surf band beginnings at the end of the 50s, through to their 80s and 90s career as a nostalgia act. The interviews are surprisingly candid and the band’s own footage (some previously unseen) from live concerts, promotional videos and behind-the-scenes tour moments will be of interest to fans. The band talk about the late 60s/early 70s period during which leader, Brian Wilson, suffered breakdowns and the band was considered irrelevant to the psychedelic “Flower Power” era.
